title: (x) Looking for the Dairy Queen logo/font
content: I know this has been addressed before ( [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/68146.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107072111/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/68146.html)) but I'm wondering if anyone knows of a good free font that would do the job just as well. I need it to do a window border for a client, who owns a DQ shop.
author: cieldailes

comments.content:
If you just need the ' [Dairy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107072111/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query_id=1800583&page=2&brand_id=1362) [Queen](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107072111/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query_id=1800583&page=2&brand_id=1361)' logo, you may be able to find it at ' [Brands of the World](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107072111/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/)'..   
_( But if its an authorized seller of 'Dairy Queen' products, the owner of the store, or you, should also be able to get a useable logo from them directly.? )_

I got a logo, all right, but it's a 200 pixel-wide .jpg (bleh). I googled for a logo and got a better one, but what I really need is the font. I can trace the shapes (letters included) easily enough in Freehand, it's just time-consuming.   
   
What I'm designing is a vinyl window border that will go across the top of all the store windows, so I'm getting everying in nice clean vectors. Having the font would just speed things up a little.

_Did you read my post.? Followed the links.?_   
You should be able to download an already vectorized version of the 'Dairy Queen' logo, from the site mentioned above, 'Brands of the World'..   
   
_\> [www.brandsoftheworld.com/download/?id=1362](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107072111/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/download/?id=1362)_   
_( This shall be a direct link to an .eps of the 'Dairy Queen' logotype.. )_

The [Brands of the World](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107072111/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/search/?query_id=1800583&page=2&brand_id=1362) site that Dav pointed out has a vector (.eps) version of the logo. If you just need the lettering, you can take it from there.   
   
 - Lex

Oh, and, for an actual ( free ) font, imitating the look; _'a parody of the classic Dairy Queen logo'_; see ' [Padaloma](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107072111/http:/www.1001fonts.com/font_details.html?font_id=2073)'.. _( I just stumbled upon this, while searching for ' [Dairy Queen Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107072111/http:/www.google.com/search?q=Dairy+Queen+Font&hl=en&lr=&start=10&sa=N)', on Google.. )_
Pity that Padaloma looks nothing like the logo...

I did follow the link, but what I need(ed) is more than just a flat picture of the logo. I had to have the lemon-shape and lettering seperate, as I have several elements to combine in different ways.   
   
But it's done now, thanks for the help anyway.
